description: '''Saw Mya Aye Kyi''' ({{langx|my|စောမြအေးကြည်}}, 1892 – 1962) was a Burmese musician who specialized in performing the collection of Burmese classical songs known as the ''[[Mahāgīta]]''. She was a [[royal mistress]] of [[Sir Sao Chel]], [[Saopha]] of [[Hsipaw State]]. She has been dubbed as the "mother of Mahāgīta." A bronze [[Bust (sculpture)|bust]] of Saw Mya Aye Kyi stands outside the [[National Theatre of Mandalay]].
